We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD3$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD3$ will be in the hundred thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{3}$ $\_$ $\_{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD4$.  

So  $\blueD4$ goes in the ten thousands place:  

$\maroonD{3}\blueD4 $\_${,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

We can continue placing the next smallest digit in the next largest place value until we have placed all six digits:

$\maroonD{3}\blueD45{,}778$
The smallest possible number we can make is $345{,}778$.
